Weevil
Snails can be significant pests in paddylands, particularly the Golden Apple Snail. Prefers wet environments like rice paddies, ponds, and irrigation canals. They are notorious for feeding on young rice seedlings, which can severely affect crop yields.
The adults feed on rice leaves, while the larvae feed on the roots. Damage to the root system can lead to poor nutrient and water uptake, causing the plants to be less resilient to stress and ultimately reducing the number of grains produced per plant.
